post.title: Digest - Week 2023/31
post.body:
ㅤ
### [Props must be serializable for components in use client file · vercel/next.js · Discussion](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/discussions/46795)
Props must be serializable for components in use client file
ㅤ
### [Salesforce Launches Starter Suite, Simplifying CRM for Small Businesses - Salesforce News](https://www.salesforce.com/news/stories/starter-small-business/)
Salesforce Starter is the fastest, easiest way to get started and grow with the #1 CRM Starter brings sales, service, and marketing capabilities together in a simple, out-of-the-box experience to help SMBs find, win, and keep customers Today, Salesforce announced general availability of Starter, a simple all-in-one CRM app bringing sales, service, and marketing capabilities […]
ㅤ
### [Speeding up the dbt™ docs by 20x with React Server Components | Dagster Blog](https://dagster.io/blog/dbt-docs-on-react)
How we dropped page load time for a large dbt project from over 4.5s to under 220ms, a 20x improvement.
ㅤ
### [Transitioning to Height Auto (Two Ways)](https://keithjgrant.com/posts/2023/04/transitioning-to-height-auto/)
Yes, there is now a way to transition an element to height auto with CSS alone.
ㅤ
### [Relay-style GraphQL | Alan Norbauer](https://alan.norbauer.com/articles/relay-style-graphql)
GraphQL best practices for 2023
ㅤ
### [A complete book dedicated to database indexes](https://sqlfordevs.com/ebooks/indexing)
Indexes can be easy. I promise.
post.excerpt: Weekly digest of my readings and interesting topics. Week 31 of 2023.
